clinical_study.brief_title: Caries Cognition and Identification in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Caries Associated With Restorations or Sialants Cognition and Identification in Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the effect of the International Dental Federation (FDI) criteria, compared to CARS (Caries Associated with Restorations or Sealants) detection criteria for evaluation of caries lesions around restorations in permanent teeth, in the outcomes related to oral health of adults, in a randomized clinical trial.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will consist of a randomized controlled trial of two parallel groups. One group will correspond to adults who will receive the diagnosis and indication of treatment according to FDI criteria (control group). And the other group will receive a diagnosis and treatment decision according to the detection criteria "Caries Associated with Restorations or Sealants" (CARS) - ICCMS (International Caries Classification and Management System) - experimental group). Patient evaluations will be performed after 12 and 24 months. The primary outcome will be the number of surfaces restored with the need for new interventions. Secondary outcomes will be: impact of oral health on quality of life and cost-effectiveness.

study_design_info.masking_description: Patients, clinical operators responsible for dental treatment, and the examiner who will assess the outcomes will be blind to the allocation group of the participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in number of surfaces restored requiring new intervention
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint will be the number of surfaces restored requiring intervention, which is composed of the sum of components with different levels of severity: number of surfaces with new caries lesions, number of surfaces restored in need of repair, replacement, teeth with episodes of pain, teeth requiring endodontic treatment or extraction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of intervention on quality of life measured by a validated questionnaire - OHIP-14 (Oral Health Impact Profile-14)

secondary_outcome.description: Effectiveness will be measured through the number of restored surfaces without intervention. The cost-effectiveness ratio will be expressed by the cost ratio of the FDI and CARS criteria and effectiveness (number of surfaces without the need for new interventions)

arm_group.description: Diagnosis and dental treatment decision based on the criteria of the International Dental Federation (FDI).
Diagnosis and dental treatment decision according to CARS (Caries Associated with Restorations or Sealants) detection criteria.

intervention.description: Dental treatment of all dental needs present in adults related or not to the dental caries
Dental treatment of all dental needs present in adults related or not to the dental caries
